title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include both of the following to describe the process in eukaryotes that ensures that the number of chromosomes will not double from parent to offspring when gametes fuse during fertilization.

· The process involves separation of homologous pairs of chromosomes in meiosis I MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeysaaaa@36C2@ so that the gametes are haploid (n).

· Each gamete receives only one member of each chromosome pair.

The response includes both of the following to describe the process in eukaryotes that ensures that the number of chromosomes will not double from parent to offspring when gametes fuse during fertilization.

· The process involves separation of homologous pairs of chromosomes in meiosis I MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeysaaaa@36C2@ so that the gametes are haploid (n).

· Each gamete receives only one member of each chromosome pair.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately explain the inheritance pattern of the disease using all of the following.

· The inheritance pattern is autosomal and recessive.

· The inheritance pattern is not sex-linked because if it was Y-linked, all male offspring of males with the disease phenotype would have the trait, and they do not.

· If the inheritance pattern was X-linked, all male offspring of females with the disease phenotype would have the trait, and they do not.

The response explains the inheritance pattern of the disease using all of the following.

· The inheritance pattern is autosomal and recessive.

· The inheritance pattern is not sex-linked because if it was Y-linked, all male offspring of males with the disease phenotype would have the trait, and they do not.

· If the inheritance pattern was X-linked, all male offspring of females with the disease phenotype would have the trait, and they do not.
